articles.author: Courtney Kube, Dan De Luce, Mosheh Gains, Henry Austin, Alexander Smith
articles.title: Niger coup jeopardizes Western fight against Islamist militants - NBC News
articles.description: A military coup in Niger has dealt a potentially devastating blow to the U.S.-led fight against Islamist extremists in Africa’s Sahel region.
articles.content: NIAMEY, Niger A military coup in Niger threatens to derail the Western fight against Islamist militants in Africas volatile Sahel region as Washington has relied heavily on the country as a hub for i… [+6480 chars]

articles.author: Mark Trevelyan, Kevin Liffey
articles.title: African leaders press Putin to end Ukraine war and restore grain supplies - Reuters
articles.description: African leaders pressed Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday to move ahead with their plan to end the Ukraine conflict and to renew a deal crucial to Africa on the safe wartime export of Ukrainian grain, which Moscow tore up last week.
articles.content: July 28 (Reuters) - African leaders pressed Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday to move ahead with their plan to end the Ukraine conflict and to renew a deal crucial to Africa on the safe wart… [+5677 chars]

articles.author: Srimoyee Chowdhury
articles.title: 'Sit, sit', Putin tells African leader as he tries to leave seat seeing others standing - India Today
articles.description: In the video, Putin can be seen holding a meeting with several African leaders. However, during the conference, the President of Comoros, Azali Assoumani, sat down at the table before anyone else.
